children.value: Used to loop through a set of images or content.
Each SwipeItem represents a carousel card, and the indicator color can be set through the

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue'
const customStyle = ref({
   color: '#ffffff',
   'font-size': '40rpx',
   'line-height': '300rpx',
   'text-align': 'center',
   'background-color': '#39a9ed'
})

children.value: The automatic rotation interval can be set through the

props.code:
<z-swipe autoplay="1000" indicator-color="#ffffff">
   <z-swipe-item
     v-for="(item, index) in 4"
     :key="index"
     :custom-style="customStyle"
     >{{ item }}</z-swipe-item
   >
</z-swipe>

import { ref } from 'vue'
const customStyle = ref({
   color: '#ffffff',
   'font-size': '40rpx',
   'line-height': '300rpx',
   'text-align': 'center',
   'background-color': '#39a9ed'
})

children.value: After each page rotation ends, the

props.code: const onChange = (index: number) => console.log('Current Swipe index: ' + index)

children.value: attribute, the sliders will be arranged vertically. In this case, you need to specify the height of the slider container.

props.code:
<z-swipe
   vertical
   indicator-color="#ffffff"
   :custom-style="{ height: '300rpx' }"
>
   <z-swipe-item
     v-for="(item, index) in 4"
     :key="index"
     :custom-style="customStyle"
     >{{ item }}</z-swipe-item
   >
</z-swipe>

children.value: The default width of the slider is
, and the width of a single slider can be set through the
property. In vertical scrolling mode, the height of a single slider can be set through the
Customizing the slider size in loop scrolling mode is currently not supported, so loop needs to be set to false.
The indicator's style can be customized via the

props.code:
<z-swipe :show-indicators="false">
   <z-swipe-item
     v-for="(item, index) in 4"
     :key="index"
     :custom-style="customStyle"
     >{{ item }}</z-swipe-item
   >
   <template #indicator="{ active, total }">
     <view class="custom-indicator">{{ active + 1 }}/{{ total }}</view>
   </template>
</z-swipe>

<style>
.custom-indicator {
   position: absolute;
   right: 10rpx;
   bottom: 10rpx;
   padding: 4rpx 10rpx;
   font-size: 24rpx;
   color: #fff;
   background: rgb(0 0 0 / 10%);
}
</style>

children.value: Automatic rotation interval, unit is ms
Whether swiping through gestures is possible
Triggered after each page carousel ends
Triggered when the user starts dragging the carousel component
Triggered when the user ends dragging the carousel component
Through ref, you can get the Swipe instance and call the instance method.
This method can be called to trigger redrawing when the size of the outer element or the display state of the component changes
The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
